abstract: Usain Bolt and Justin Gatlin both win their 100-meter heats at world track and field championships in Beijing, bringing them closer to first-ever confrontation; possible showdown between celebrated Bolt and Gatlin, who has been sanctioned for doping offense, could be simplistically characterized by many as good versus evil.
lead_paragraph: Bolt and Gatlin, who have neither raced each other nor lost in their trademark sprints since 2013, both won their 100-meter heats Saturday at the world championships in Beijing.

headline.main: Looming Confrontation of Usain Bolt and Justin Gatlin Would Be a Morality Play
headline.print_headline: Looming Confrontation of Bolt and Gatlin Would Be a Morality Play

snippet: Bolt and Gatlin, who have neither raced each other nor lost in their trademark sprints since 2013, both won their 100-meter heats Saturday at the world championships in Beijing.
